Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a direct attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental human right.
The bill's definitions of misinformation are subjective and vague, granting the government arbitrary powers.
The legislation creates an imbalance by protecting government, mainstream media, and approved organizations, while silencing independent voices.
The bill empowers ACMA with excessive powers to impose fines, creating a chilling effect on free expression.
The prohibition of open dialogue has had negative consequences, particularly in healthcare during the pandemic.
The bill is viewed as a threat to democracy and individual rights in Australia.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is an essential human right and a fundamental principle of Australian democracy.
The Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023 is an affront to our way of life and must be rejected.
The bill empowers the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) with draconian powers to silence the critics of the government.
